trans-unit.source: Replace a PCM on your StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Replace a PCM on your StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains how to remove and replace the Power and Cooling Module (PCM) on your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Explains how to remove and replace the Power and Cooling Module (PCM) on your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: The Power and Cooling Module (PCM) in your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device consists of a power supply and cooling fans that are controlled through the primary and EBOD enclosures.
trans-unit.target: The Power and Cooling Module (PCM) in your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device consists of a power supply and cooling fans that are controlled through the primary and EBOD enclosures.

trans-unit.source: There is only one model of PCM that is certified for each enclosure.
trans-unit.target: There is only one model of PCM that is certified for each enclosure.

trans-unit.source: The primary enclosure is certified for a 764 W PCM and the EBOD enclosure is certified for a 580 W PCM.
trans-unit.target: The primary enclosure is certified for a 764 W PCM and the EBOD enclosure is certified for a 580 W PCM.

trans-unit.source: Although the PCMs for the primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure are different, the replacement procedure is identical.
trans-unit.target: Although the PCMs for the primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure are different, the replacement procedure is identical.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to:

trans-unit.source: Remove a PCM
trans-unit.target: Remove a PCM

trans-unit.source: Install a replacement PCM
trans-unit.target: Install a replacement PCM

trans-unit.source: Before removing and replacing a PCM, review the safety information in <linkText>StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Before removing and replacing a PCM, review the safety information in <linkText>StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Be aware of the following important issues before you replace your PCM:
trans-unit.target: Be aware of the following important issues before you replace your PCM:

trans-unit.source: If the power supply of the PCM fails, leave the faulty module installed, but remove the power cord.
trans-unit.target: If the power supply of the PCM fails, leave the faulty module installed, but remove the power cord.

trans-unit.source: The fan will continue to receive power from the enclosure and continue to provide proper cooling.
trans-unit.target: The fan will continue to receive power from the enclosure and continue to provide proper cooling.

trans-unit.source: If the fan fails, the PCM needs to be replaced immediately.
trans-unit.target: If the fan fails, the PCM needs to be replaced immediately.

trans-unit.source: Before removing the PCM, disconnect the power from the PCM by turning off the main switch (where present) or by physically removing the power cord.
trans-unit.target: Before removing the PCM, disconnect the power from the PCM by turning off the main switch (where present) or by physically removing the power cord.

trans-unit.source: This provides a warning to your system that a power shutdown is imminent.
trans-unit.target: This provides a warning to your system that a power shutdown is imminent.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the other PCM is functional for continued system operation before replacing the faulty PCM.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the other PCM is functional for continued system operation before replacing the faulty PCM.

trans-unit.source: A faulty PCM must be replaced by a fully operational PCM as soon as possible.
trans-unit.target: A faulty PCM must be replaced by a fully operational PCM as soon as possible.

trans-unit.source: PCM module replacement takes only few minutes to complete, but it must be completed within 10 minutes of removing the failed PCM to prevent overheating.
trans-unit.target: PCM module replacement takes only few minutes to complete, but it must be completed within 10 minutes of removing the failed PCM to prevent overheating.

trans-unit.source: Follow these instructions when you are ready to remove a Power and Cooling Module (PCM) from your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Follow these instructions when you are ready to remove a Power and Cooling Module (PCM) from your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Before you remove your PCM, verify that you have a correct replacement (764 W for the primary enclosure or 580 W for the EBOD enclosure).
trans-unit.target: Before you remove your PCM, verify that you have a correct replacement (764 W for the primary enclosure or 580 W for the EBOD enclosure).

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status.

trans-unit.source: Check the status of the PCM components under Shared Components to identify which PCM has failed:
trans-unit.target: Check the status of the PCM components under Shared Components to identify which PCM has failed:

trans-unit.source: If a power supply in PCM 0 has failed, the status of Power Supply in PCM 0 will be red.
trans-unit.target: If a power supply in PCM 0 has failed, the status of Power Supply in PCM 0 will be red.

trans-unit.source: If a power supply in PCM 1 has failed, the status of Power Supply in PCM 1 will be red.
trans-unit.target: If a power supply in PCM 1 has failed, the status of Power Supply in PCM 1 will be red.

trans-unit.source: If the fan in PCM 1 has failed, the status of either Cooling 0 for PCM 0 or Cooling 1 for PCM 0 will be red.
trans-unit.target: If the fan in PCM 1 has failed, the status of either Cooling 0 for PCM 0 or Cooling 1 for PCM 0 will be red.

trans-unit.source: Locate the failed PCM on the back of the primary enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Locate the failed PCM on the back of the primary enclosure.

trans-unit.source: If you are running a 8600 model, identify the primary enclosure by looking at the System Unit Identification Number shown on the front panel LED display.
trans-unit.target: If you are running a 8600 model, identify the primary enclosure by looking at the System Unit Identification Number shown on the front panel LED display.

trans-unit.source: The default Unit ID displayed on the primary enclosure is 00, whereas the default Unit ID displayed on the EBOD enclosure is 01.
trans-unit.target: The default Unit ID displayed on the primary enclosure is 00, whereas the default Unit ID displayed on the EBOD enclosure is 01.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram and table explain the front panel of the LED display.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram and table explain the front panel of the LED display.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>System ID on front OPS panel</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>System ID on front OPS panel</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 1 Front panel of the device
trans-unit.target: Figure 1 Front panel of the device

trans-unit.source: |Label|Description| |:---|:-----------| |1|Mute button| |2|System power| |3|Module fault| |4|Logical fault| |5|Unit ID display|
trans-unit.target: |Label|Description| |:---|:-----------| |1|Mute button| |2|System power| |3|Module fault| |4|Logical fault| |5|Unit ID display|

trans-unit.source: The monitoring indicator LEDs in the back of the primary enclosure can also be used to identify the faulty PCM.
trans-unit.target: The monitoring indicator LEDs in the back of the primary enclosure can also be used to identify the faulty PCM.

trans-unit.source: See the following diagram and table to understand how to use the LEDs to locate the faulty PCM.
trans-unit.target: See the following diagram and table to understand how to use the LEDs to locate the faulty PCM.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the LED corresponding to the Fan Fail is lit, the fan has failed.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the LED corresponding to the Fan Fail is lit, the fan has failed.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, if the LED corresponding to AC Fail is lit, the power supply has failed.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, if the LED corresponding to AC Fail is lit, the power supply has failed.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backplane of device PCM monitoring indicator LEDs</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backplane of device PCM monitoring indicator LEDs</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 2 Back of PCM with indicator LEDs
trans-unit.target: Figure 2 Back of PCM with indicator LEDs

trans-unit.source: |Label|Description| |:---|:-----------| |1|AC power failure| |2|Fan failure| |3|Battery fault| |4|PCM OK| |5|DC power failure| |6|Battery healthy|
trans-unit.target: |Label|Description| |:---|:-----------| |1|AC power failure| |2|Fan failure| |3|Battery fault| |4|PCM OK| |5|DC power failure| |6|Battery healthy|

trans-unit.source: Refer to the following diagram of the back of the StorSimple device to locate the failed PCM module.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the following diagram of the back of the StorSimple device to locate the failed PCM module.

trans-unit.source: PCM 0 is on the left and PCM 1 is on the right.
trans-unit.target: PCM 0 is on the left and PCM 1 is on the right.

trans-unit.source: The table that follows explains the modules.
trans-unit.target: The table that follows explains the modules.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backplane of device primary enclosure modules</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backplane of device primary enclosure modules</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 3 Back of device with plug-in modules
trans-unit.target: Figure 3 Back of device with plug-in modules

trans-unit.source: |Label|Description| |:---|:-----------| |1|PCM 0| |2|PCM 1| |3|Controller 0| |4|Controller 1|
trans-unit.target: |Label|Description| |:---|:-----------| |1|PCM 0| |2|PCM 1| |3|Controller 0| |4|Controller 1|

trans-unit.source: Turn off the faulty PCM and disconnect the power supply cord.
trans-unit.target: Turn off the faulty PCM and disconnect the power supply cord.

trans-unit.source: You can now remove the PCM.
trans-unit.target: You can now remove the PCM.

trans-unit.source: Grasp the latch and the side of the PCM handle between your thumb and forefinger, and squeeze them together to open the handle.
trans-unit.target: Grasp the latch and the side of the PCM handle between your thumb and forefinger, and squeeze them together to open the handle.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Opening PCM Handle</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Opening PCM Handle</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 4 Opening the PCM handle
trans-unit.target: Figure 4 Opening the PCM handle

trans-unit.source: Grip the handle and remove the PCM.
trans-unit.target: Grip the handle and remove the PCM.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Removing Device PCM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Removing Device PCM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 5 Removing the PCM
trans-unit.target: Figure 5 Removing the PCM

trans-unit.source: Follow these instructions to install a PCM in your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Follow these instructions to install a PCM in your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Verify that you have the correct replacement PCM for this enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Verify that you have the correct replacement PCM for this enclosure.

trans-unit.source: The primary enclosure needs a 764 W PCM and the EBOD enclosure needs a 580 W PCM.
trans-unit.target: The primary enclosure needs a 764 W PCM and the EBOD enclosure needs a 580 W PCM.

trans-unit.source: You should not attempt to use the 580 W PCM in the Primary enclosure, or the 764 W PCM in the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: You should not attempt to use the 580 W PCM in the Primary enclosure, or the 764 W PCM in the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows where to identify this information on the label that is affixed to the PCM.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows where to identify this information on the label that is affixed to the PCM.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Device PCM Label</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Device PCM Label</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 6 PCM label
trans-unit.target: Figure 6 PCM label

trans-unit.source: Check for damage to the enclosure, paying particular attention to the connectors.
trans-unit.target: Check for damage to the enclosure, paying particular attention to the connectors.

trans-unit.source: Do not install the module if any connector pins are bent.
trans-unit.target: Do not install the module if any connector pins are bent.

trans-unit.source: With the PCM handle in the open position, slide the module into the enclosure.
trans-unit.target: With the PCM handle in the open position, slide the module into the enclosure.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Installing Device PCM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Installing Device PCM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 7 Installing the PCM
trans-unit.target: Figure 7 Installing the PCM

trans-unit.source: Manually close the PCM handle.
trans-unit.target: Manually close the PCM handle.

trans-unit.source: You should hear a click as the handle latch engages.
trans-unit.target: You should hear a click as the handle latch engages.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that the connector pins have engaged, you can gently tug on the handle without releasing the latch.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that the connector pins have engaged, you can gently tug on the handle without releasing the latch.

trans-unit.source: If the PCM slides out, it implies that the latch was closed before the connectors engaged.
trans-unit.target: If the PCM slides out, it implies that the latch was closed before the connectors engaged.

trans-unit.source: Connect the power cables to the power source and to the PCM.
trans-unit.target: Connect the power cables to the power source and to the PCM.

trans-unit.source: Secure the strain relief bales.
trans-unit.target: Secure the strain relief bales.

trans-unit.source: Turn on the PCM.
trans-unit.target: Turn on the PCM.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the replacement was successful: in the Management Portal of your StorSimple Manager service, navigate to Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the replacement was successful: in the Management Portal of your StorSimple Manager service, navigate to Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status.

trans-unit.source: Under Shared Components, the status of the PCM should be green.
trans-unit.target: Under Shared Components, the status of the PCM should be green.

trans-unit.source: It may take a few minutes for the replacement PCM to completely initialize.
trans-unit.target: It may take a few minutes for the replacement PCM to completely initialize.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about <linkText>StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about <linkText>StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title>.
